title: Relationship with Colleagues
description: You spend a significant portion of your life with colleagues. Building positive, professional relationships makes your job more enjoyable and is crucial for your career growth. It's about being friendly, but not necessarily friends.
sentences: Be reliable, meet your deadlines, and pull your weight on team projects.
Communicate clearly, respectfully, and professionally in all forms (email, chat, in-person).
Offer help when you can, and don't be afraid to ask for it when you need it.
Maintain a positive attitude and avoid complaining constantly.
Respect others' time, work styles, and personal boundaries.
dos: Participate in team-building activities and social events.
Give credit where credit is due.
Keep your workspace tidy, especially in a shared office.
donts: Don't overshare details of your personal life.
Don't eat smelly food at your desk.
Don't avoid difficult conversations; address conflicts professionally and directly.
